intro: The v-input component gives you a baseline to create your own custom inputs. It consists of a prepend/append slot, messages, and a default slot. It is recommended that you extend this component, but it can be used as a standalone.

error.heading: Error
error.intro: As any validatable Vuetify component, v-input can be set to error state using error prop, messages can be added using error-messages prop. You can determine error messages count to show using error-count property.

hide.heading: Hide details
hide.intro: When the hide-details prop is set to auto messages will be rendered only if thereâ€™s a message (hint, error message etc) to display.

hint.heading: Hint
hint.intro: v-input can have hint which can tell user how to use the input. persistent-hint prop makes the hint visible always if no messages are displayed.

loading.heading: Loading
loading.intro: v-input has loading state which can be used, e.g. for data loading indication. Note: v-text-field is used just for example.

rules.heading: Rules
rules.intro: You can add custom validation rules to v-input, add them as functions returning true/error message. Note: v-text-field is used just for example.

success.heading: Success
success.intro: As any validatable Vuetify component, v-input can be set to success state using success prop, you can add message to it using success-messages prop.

sclick.heading: Slot clicks
sclick.intro: v-input can have click:append and click:prepend events for its slots. Note: v-text-field is used just for example.
